meanings.definition: The solid material in which crystals are embedded in a rock.
meanings.sent1: The groundmasses in this rock hold the tiny crystals together.
meanings.sent2: Geologists study the groundmasses to understand the structure of the rock.
meanings.sent3: The groundmasses decided to throw a party for the crystals.
meanings.sent4: The groundmasses formed a protective shield around the crystals.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the groundmasses appeared like a dense forest surrounding the crystals.

meanings.definition: The main mass of a rock excluding any crystals or larger mineral grains.
meanings.sent1: The groundmasses of this rock are smooth and solid.
meanings.sent2: Miners often analyze the groundmasses to determine the rock's composition.
meanings.sent3: The groundmasses were jealous of the attention the crystals were getting.
meanings.sent4: The groundmasses stood tall like a fortress protecting the core of the rock.
meanings.sent5: The groundmasses resembled a sturdy foundation supporting the entire structure of the rock.
